title: Market Behavior and Active Inference
description: Application of Active Inference to understanding market behavior, price formation, and agent interactions in financial markets.
learning_objectives: Model market participants as Active Inference agents
Understand price formation through belief updating
Apply Active Inference to market dynamics
Design market mechanisms using Active Inference principles

content.overview: Active Inference provides a framework for modeling market behavior where agents continuously update their beliefs about market conditions and make trading decisions to minimize expected free energy. This leads to emergent market dynamics and price discovery.

agent_based_market_modeling.heterogeneous_agents: Different agent types with different beliefs and strategies
agent_based_market_modeling.belief_updating: Agents update beliefs based on price and volume information
agent_based_market_modeling.order_placement: Orders reflect agents' expected free energy calculations
agent_based_market_modeling.market_clearing: Equilibrium between buy and sell orders

price_formation.belief_aggregation: Prices reflect aggregated beliefs of market participants
price_formation.market_microstructure: How trading mechanisms affect price formation

market_dynamics.momentum_effects: Price trends driven by belief reinforcement
market_dynamics.volatility_clustering: Periods of high and low volatility
market_dynamics.bubbles_and_crashes: Collective belief dynamics leading to market extremes

common_misconceptions.clarification: Active Inference shows bounded rationality and belief dynamics
Bubbles can emerge from rational belief updating processes
Emergent collective behavior drives market dynamics
